title: Bayanat, Yahsat and ICEYE announce program to broaden commercial opportunities across the UAE space ecosystem
key_assets: SAR satellite constellation (at least 5 LEO satellites)
summary: Bayanat, Yahsat, and ICEYE have announced a comprehensive Space Program to develop national satellite remote sensing and Earth Observation (EO) capabilities in the UAE. The program includes the development of a constellation of at least five SAR LEO satellites, leveraging ICEYE's SAR technology and Yahsat's satellite infrastructure. The partnership aims to enhance commercial offerings, provide sovereign SAR data, and foster collaboration within the UAE's space ecosystem. The first LEO satellite launch is scheduled for Q1 2024.
why_it_matters: This partnership strengthens the UAE's position in the global EO market by establishing sovereign SAR data capabilities, enhancing data privacy, and fostering in-country satellite manufacturing. It also drives commercial growth for Bayanat and Yahsat while positioning ICEYE as a key technology provider in the UAE's space sector. The program aligns with the UAE's Space Strategy 2030 and supports economic growth and skill development in the region.

entities.name: Bayanat
entities.involvement: Lead in AI-powered geospatial solutions and downstream capabilities; developing SAR satellite constellation

entities.name: Yahsat
entities.involvement: Provides satellite infrastructure and midstream capabilities; supports UAE's space strategy

entities.name: ICEYE
entities.involvement: SAR satellite manufacturer; provides technology and access to existing satellites until UAE constellation launch
